General Info

The Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus is located in the eastern side of Mediterranean on an area of 3.355 square miles. The island is 70 kilometers away from Turkey and 385 kilometers away from Egypt. Northern Cyprus has a climate which can be characterized with its long, hot summers and short, mild winters.

The most popular city in Northern Cyprus is Kyrenia which is known for its luxury hotels-casinos and clean-sandy beaches. Kyrenia also has many historical places to visit, such as Antiphonitis Monastery, Bellapais Abbey and St. Hillarion Castle.

The capital city Nicosia, which has a population of 35,000, is the political and business district of the country. The city provides the main framework of the country with its business centers, two universities and an international airport. The church of St. Nicolas and Arab Ahmet Mosque are the places worthy of a visit in Nicosia.

Famagusta is one of the oldest cities in Cyprus and is situated on the northern east coast of the island. Famagusta has lots of world class resort hotel and casinos for accommodation, and offers many ancient buildings such as Othello Tower, Salamis Ruins and St. Nicolas Cathedral to visit.

The other important city is GÃ¼zelyurt which means "beautiful city" in English. This city is known for its large fruit gardens and is called the water store of the island because of its high water capacity. St. Mamas Monastery and Church and Vouni Palace are the historical places which must be seen in GÃ¼zelyurt.

Necessary Telephone Numbers:
  • Police 155
  • Hospital 112
  • Fire 199

Language: The local language is Turkish but English is spoken and understood throughout the country.

Transportation: International transportation is provided by Kyrenia port and Ercan Airport in Nicosia.

Accommodation: Northern Cyprus has many accommodation alternatives such as small family hotels, luxury-resort hotels, holiday villages and self-catering villas.
